news_header: The text describes the aftermath of conflict in Rafah, Gaza, focusing on the search for missing persons and the emotional toll on families as they confront the remains of loved ones.
news_text: In Rafah, Gaza, the aftermath of conflict has left many families searching for missing relatives among the rubble. Haitham al-Homs, director of Emergency Services, reports numerous calls from civilians seeking loved ones' bodies. The Palestinian health authorities estimate 10,000 people are missing. Search teams rely on markers like clothing and the smell of death to locate remains. Families visit hospitals to identify remains, often finding their loved ones in body bags. The story also highlights the tragic case of Aya al-Dabeh, a young girl killed by a sniper, whose remains were disturbed, leaving her family in despair. The emotional toll of loss and the search for closure are central themes.
